author: Crypt32
body:
<!--

For Windows PowerShell 5.1 issues, suggestions, or feature requests please use the following link instead:
- Windows PowerShell [UserVoice](https://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869-powershell)

If it is a bug report:
- make sure you are able to repro it on the latest released version. 
You can install the latest version from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/known-issues-ps6?view=powershell-6).
- Fill out the following repro template:

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->

Steps to reproduce
------------------

```powershell
Get-Help Get-Content -Full
```

Expected behavior
-----------------

```none

```

Actual behavior
---------------

```none
    <CommonParameters>
        This cmdlet supports the common parameters: Verbose, Debug,
        ErrorAction, ErrorVariable, WarningAction, WarningVariable,
        OutBuffer, PipelineVariable, and OutVariable. For more information, see
        about_CommonParameters (https:/go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=113216). <--- broken
```
Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      5.1.17134.165
PSEdition                      Desktop
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
BuildVersion                   10.0.17134.165
CLRVersion                     4.0.30319.42000
WSManStackVersion              3.0
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
```

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @Crypt32 Can you repo with latest build PowerShell Core?

comments.author: Crypt32
comments.body: I don't have access to PS Core

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: The repo is for PowerShell Core. For Windows PowerShell please report to UserVoice site.

comments.author: mklement0
comments.body:
@Crypt32:

The problem currently affects all cmdlets (in both editions, because the problem is on the sever side), it seems, and has already been reported in the docs repo:

https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell-Docs/issues/2900

As a  stopgap, you can manually correct the URL and refresh the page - see https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell-Docs/issues/2900#issuecomment-422897225

That said, simply googling by cmdlet name may get you there more quickly.

Also - and you may be well aware of that - remember that the quickest way to open an online help page for a cmdlet is to use `Get-Help -Online` , e.g. `Get-Help -Online Get-Content` - of course, that's only useful if the link isn't broken.

title: Broken link in about_CommonParameters
